episodeTitle: The Key to Turning the Tide and a Great Escape! Doru Doru Ball!
japaneseTitl: 逆転大脱出への鍵！ドルドルボール！
romanizedTitle: Gyakuten dai dasshutsu e no kagi! Dorudoru Bōru!
description: Chopper distracts Crocodile while Sanji frees the imprisoned Straw Hats and Smoker from their cage. Mr. 3 emerges alive from a Bananawani's stomach using his wax powers. Despite Crocodile revealing he had the real key all along, the crew uses Mr. 3's abilities to create a copy key and escape toward Alubarna.

events.title: Chopper Distracts Crocodile
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper bravely confronts Crocodile to buy time for Sanji to rescue the imprisoned crew members. Despite being vastly outmatched, Chopper uses his transformations to keep the Warlord occupied.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's courage and willingness to risk his life for his new crewmates, showing his growth as a Straw Hat pirate.

events.title: Anti-Manner Kick Course Debut
events.description: Sanji debuts his powerful new technique, Anti-Manner Kick Course, delivering a massive 180-degree kick to defeat a Bananawani threatening the imprisoned crew. The technique demonstrates Sanji's increased combat prowess.
events.significance: First appearance of one of Sanji's signature finishing moves. This technique becomes a staple of his fighting style throughout the series, used to defeat powerful opponents with a single devastating kick.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji debuts his powerful finishing kick to defeat the Bananawani

events.title: Mr. 3 Emerges from Bananawani with Doru Doru Ball
events.description: Mr. 3 (Galdino) emerges alive from inside a Bananawani's stomach, having protected himself from the stomach acid by encasing himself in a ball of wax using his Doru Doru no Mi powers. This technique, called Doru Doru Ball, demonstrates a defensive application of his Devil Fruit abilities.
events.significance: Reveals Mr. 3's survival and introduces the Doru Doru Ball technique, showing the versatility of the Doru Doru no Mi beyond offensive attacks. This moment becomes crucial for the crew's escape plan.

events.title: Mr. 3 Throws the Key Among Bananawani
events.description: In a panicked state, Mr. 3 throws the cage key among three Bananawani when approached by Sanji. This creates a dangerous situation where retrieving the key becomes nearly impossible.
events.significance: This moment appears to doom the escape attempt, raising the stakes and forcing the crew to find an alternative solution. It demonstrates Mr. 3's fearful and reactive nature.

events.title: Crocodile Reveals He Had the Real Key
events.description: Crocodile reveals that he possessed the real cage key all along, demonstrating his manipulative nature and love of psychological torture. He had been toying with the prisoners' hopes of escape while holding the actual key.
events.significance: Shows Crocodile's sadistic personality and strategic mind. He enjoys crushing his enemies' hopes and watching them struggle futilely. This revelation emphasizes his role as a calculating villain.

quotes.text: I've had the real key this entire time.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals his deception to the imprisoned crew

events.title: Usopp's Plan to Use Mr. 3's Wax Powers
events.description: Usopp devises a clever plan to use Mr. 3's Doru Doru no Mi abilities to create a wax copy of the cage key. This ingenious solution allows them to escape despite losing the original key to the Bananawani.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's intelligence and creative problem-solving abilities. His quick thinking saves the crew from certain death and shows that he contributes to the team through brains, not just bravery.

events.title: Sanji Forces Mr. 3 to Create Wax Key
events.description: Sanji convinces (or forces) Mr. 3 to use his Devil Fruit powers to create a perfect wax replica of the cage key. Mr. 3 reluctantly complies, creating the key that will free the imprisoned Straw Hats and Smoker.
events.significance: The wax key becomes the literal key to their escape. This shows how the Straw Hats can turn even their enemies' abilities to their advantage through clever tactics.

events.title: The Great Escape from the Cage
events.description: Using Mr. 3's wax key, the Straw Hats and Smoker successfully escape from their cage before Crocodile returns. They manage to flee the underwater chamber of Rain Dinners, swimming to safety.
events.significance: A crucial turning point in the Arabasta Arc. The crew's escape allows them to continue their mission to stop the rebellion and defeat Crocodile. Without this escape, the arc would have ended with their deaths.

events.title: Zoro Saves Smoker on Luffy's Orders
events.description: During the escape, Zoro carries the weakened Smoker to safety. When Smoker questions why a pirate would save a Marine, Zoro reveals it was Luffy's direct order, showing Luffy's character and the crew's loyalty to their captain's decisions.
events.significance: This moment begins to shift Smoker's perspective on Luffy and the Straw Hats. It shows that despite being pirates, they have honor and compassion. This plants the seeds for Smoker's more nuanced view of Luffy in future arcs.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro explains to Smoker why he saved him despite being a Marine

events.title: Smoker's Perspective on Luffy Changes
events.description: After being saved by the Straw Hats despite being their enemy, Smoker experiences a shift in his perspective. Annoyed by Luffy's illogical but honorable behavior, Smoker decides not to arrest them for the time being, acknowledging the debt he owes them.
events.significance: A pivotal character moment for Smoker. This marks the beginning of his complex relationship with Luffy - still duty-bound to capture him, but respecting his character. This theme continues throughout the series.

events.title: Miss All Sunday's Bounty and History Revealed
events.description: Smoker reveals to the Straw Hats that Miss All Sunday (Nico Robin) is a wanted criminal with a bounty of 79 million berries. He explains that the World Government has been chasing her for 20 years, making her one of the most wanted people in the world.
events.significance: First revelation to the Straw Hats about Robin's criminal status and her dangerous position. This information foreshadows her eventual joining of the crew and the conflicts that will arise from her past.

events.title: Heading to Alubarna
events.description: With Crocodile's trap escaped, the Straw Hats declare they will not stop running until they reach Alubarna, the capital of Arabasta. They race to stop the rebellion before it's too late.
events.significance: Sets up the next phase of the arc. The crew's journey to Alubarna becomes a desperate race against time to prevent civil war and defeat Crocodile's plan.

quotes.text: We won't stop running until we reach Alubarna!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares their determination to reach the capital

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji debuts his powerful finishing kick

quotes.text: I've had the real key this entire time.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
Zoro
quotes.context: Explaining to Smoker why they saved him

quotes.text: We won't stop running until we reach Alubarna!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Declaring their determination to reach the capital

themes.description: The episode showcases how clever thinking and resourcefulness can overcome seemingly impossible situations. Usopp's plan to use Mr. 3's wax powers demonstrates that intelligence is as valuable as combat strength.
themes.symbolism: The wax key symbolizes how unconventional solutions and creative thinking can unlock impossible situations.

themes.description: Despite being enemies, Luffy orders his crew to save Smoker, showing that the Straw Hats operate by a moral code that transcends simple pirate-Marine antagonism. This honorable action begins to change Smoker's perspective.
themes.symbolism: Saving Smoker represents the Straw Hats' core values - they don't abandon people in need, even their enemies.

themes.description: The escape succeeds because each crew member plays their part: Chopper distracts Crocodile, Sanji fights the Bananawani, Usopp devises the plan, and everyone works together to execute it.
themes.symbolism: The collaborative escape demonstrates that the Straw Hats' strength comes from unity and mutual trust.

themes.description: Crocodile's reveal that he had the real key all along emphasizes his cruel, manipulative nature. He doesn't just want to defeat his enemies - he wants to torture them psychologically and crush their hope.
themes.symbolism: The duplicate key represents false hope, while Crocodile's possession of the real key symbolizes his control and sadism.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji demonstrates his growing combat prowess with the debut of Anti-Manner Kick Course while also showing his tactical mind in freeing the crew and securing Mr. 3's cooperation.
keyActions: Defeats Bananawani with Anti-Manner Kick Course
Forces Mr. 3 to create the wax key

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp proves his value to the crew through intelligence rather than strength, devising the plan that saves everyone's lives using Mr. 3's Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Devises the plan to use Mr. 3's wax powers

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper shows courage beyond his size by confronting the fearsome Warlord Crocodile to buy time for his crewmates, demonstrating his loyalty and growth as a Straw Hat.
keyActions: Buys time for Sanji's rescue operation

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 3's survival and subsequent forced cooperation shows his resourcefulness with his Devil Fruit powers, even as he remains a cowardly and self-serving character.
keyActions: Survives being eaten by Bananawani using Doru Doru Ball

characterSpotlights.development: Smoker's worldview begins to shift as he's saved by pirates he's sworn to capture. His decision not to arrest them shows the beginning of his complex relationship with Luffy.
keyActions: Accepts rescue from the Straw Hats
Chooses not to arrest them despite his duty
Reveals information about Miss All Sunday

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile's reveal of the real key showcases his psychological cruelty and manipulative nature, establishing him as one of the most sinister villains the crew has faced.
keyActions: Reveals he had the real key all along
quotes: I've had the real key this entire time.

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, the events detailing how the Straw Hats and Smoker escaped are revealed at the same time Crocodile returns to the room. In the manga, the escape was shown in a flashback after Crocodile's return.
When Sanji approaches Mr. 3 for the key, Mr. 3 acts startled with an exaggerated reaction in the anime. In the manga, Mr. 3 noticed Sanji with a much less exaggerated reaction.

The anime fixes a continuity error from the manga where Mr. 3 was mysteriously floating in water despite being a Devil Fruit user. Instead, he clings to remnants of the dining table within Crocodile's underwater base. Oda later retconned this as Mr. 3 being on 'super-floaty wood'.

trivia.fact: Episode 109 aired on April 28, 2002, in Japan, during the height of the Arabasta Arc's popularity.
This episode covers chapters 175 and 176 of the manga, titled 'The Key to a Comeback' and 'Luffy vs. Vivi,' respectively.
The Anti-Manner Kick Course technique debuts in this episode and becomes one of Sanji's signature finishing moves throughout the series.

sources.title: Black Leg Style - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Doru Doru Ball technique shown in this episode demonstrates Mr. 3's ability to use his wax defensively, not just for creating offensive structures like his earlier candle-based attacks.

sources.title: Doru Doru no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: In the 4Kids English dub, this episode was titled 'The Great Escape' and aired on February 3, 2007, heavily censored and edited.

This episode marks an important turning point in Smoker's character arc, beginning his complex relationship with Luffy that continues throughout the series, particularly in Punk Hazard and Dressrosa arcs.
The episode has an 8.4 rating on IMDb, indicating strong fan reception for this escape sequence.
